posts.title: The Railway Children
posts.excerpt: The Railway Children (1970) Quote:This adaptation of E. Nesbit’s story is now regarded as its definitive telling, its popular memory greater than that of her novel. posts.title: Anamnesis
posts.excerpt: Anamnesis (2021) What we don’t see is the face of the most important figure in the film, Stefan S., who is serving a life sentence in a Brandenburg jail.

posts.title: Caprice
posts.excerpt: Caprice (1986) Quote:A girl finds herself inside a fashion magazine – Joanna Hogg’s graduation piece at the National Film and Television School starring a then unknown Tilda Swinton.

posts._title: Michel Gondry – The We and the I (2012)
posts.title: The We and the I
posts.excerpt: The We and the I (2012) A look at the lives of a group of teenagers who ride the same bus route, and how their relationships change and evolve on the last day of school.

posts.title: Plenty
posts.excerpt: Susan Traherne (Meryl Streep) is a young woman who, during World War II, joins the provincial French Resistance as an undercover British agent. The highlight of her time in France is a night of passion with another agent, codenamed Lazar (Sam Neill), who briefly passes through her sector. As she struggles to adjust to life …

posts._title: William A. Graham – 21 Hours at Munich (1976)
posts.title: 21 Hours at Munich
posts.excerpt: 21 Hours at Munich (1976) A dramatization of the incident in 1972 when Arab terrorists broke into the Olympic compound in Munich and murdered eleven Israeli athletes.
